intro: Nodonema, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces clusters of blue or purple flowers during the summer months. Nodonema is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
